comments:
I tried to start up an old test workspace with the M5 candidate.  From the 
file dates it appears the workspace is from 12/17/02.  This is probably the 
workspace I used for testing M4.

The error is included below.

The workspace is available if needed.

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 06, 2003 16:29:52.831
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Fatal Error: Unable to locate matching

Did you install M5 in the same directory as the previous eclipse ?
Zip the .config directory and attach it.

This means eclipse startup loade a boot.jar, looked at the associate boot.xml,
attempted to load a runtime.jar and failed to find the matching runtime.jar.
Either the build is wrong or the reconciliation disabled all the plugins.

I'm not sure of your question.  My workspace directory is outside my eclipse 
install directory.  I deleted the eclipse install and unzipped M5 candidate.  
I then started it up with -data pointing to my old workspace.

Created an attachment (id=3344)
Config as requested

Thanks, 
So you installed M5 in the same directory as the previous eclipse (you deleted
eclipse, then installed M5). The eclipse startup behaves differently when the
install directory (the path where it is installed) is changed.

Now, very strange config...
it seems you have 3 sites with plugins (C:\,C:\eclipse and c:\eclipse-workspace)
and all in INCLUDE mode where I would have expected only one site (C:\eclipse)
and in the exclude mode (only PDE knows how to create INCLUDE mode sites :-)

I believe c:\eclipse-workspace is the place where your workspace is, right ?
How do you start eclipse? What command line?

It seems startup included the plugins in your eclipse-workspace on the startup...

>>I believe c:\eclipse-workspace is the place where your workspace is, right ?

Yes.

>>How do you start eclipse? What command line?

Nothing special.  I think it was:

D:\eclipse\eclipse.exe -vm d:\jdk\ibm\n140p\jre\bin\javaw.exe -data 
D:\eclipse_workspace\plugins

Not current any more - please reopen if expiriencing the same problem with a 
2.1 release driver.

causedBy.message: Fatal Error: Unable to locate matching  org.eclipse.core.runtime plugin.
